roleset.name: rise incrementally, quickly and a lot

role.descr: attribute, specific aspect of arg1 that is leaping

example.name: leap-v: typical usage
example.text: The Nasdaq composite leaped 7.52 points, or 1.6%, to 470.80.

example.name: take_leap-l: with attribute
example.text: Interactive telephone technology has taken a new leap in sophistication , and television programmers are racing to exploit the possibilities .

example.name: leap-n: Args 1, 3, 4
example.text: Following the leap in the Consumer Prices Index (CPI) from 2.2% to 3% in April the CPI has risen to 3.3% in May.

roleset.note: LEAP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls run-51.3.2.This frame based on jump. Refer to other verbs-of-stock-reportage (rise, fall, climb, jump, etc)for additional examples. (from leap.01-v)
LEAP-N NOTES: Based on verb entry leap.01; corresponds to Vncls run-51.3.2. (from leap.01-n)
LEAPING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from leaping.01-n)

roleset.name: be excited for an opportunity

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: " And now , because of the trend in society of reviving Taiwanese as the mother tongue , Taiwanese drama has been able to leap into prime time to become the mainstream offering in the past few years . "

example.name: leap-v: Opportunity only
example.text: He would pass by a leap at the opportunity.

roleset.note: LEAP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'leap' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. (from leap.02-v predicate notes)
LEAPING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from leaping.02-n)

roleset.name: physically leap

example.name: ARG0
example.text: Leaping into rages , sinking into bouts of drunkenness and mistrust , Mr. Noriega has put to death some 70 of his troops involved in the coup , according to U.S. officials monitoring crematoriums and funeral parlors in Panama City .

example.name: leap-v
example.text: [*] Half crazed [*-1]by the weight dragging , the dust , and the heat , the horse leaped our wall , [*-2] dashing out the rider 's brains against it , and leaving him lying there among us -- while the horse crashed away through the brush .
example.arg: Half crazed [*-1]by the weight dragging , the dust , and the heat
dashing out the rider 's brains against it , and leaving him lying there among us -- while the horse crashed away through the brush

example.name: leaping-n
example.text: Whether or not Alice had anything to do with his leaping over the wall is unclear.

example.name: leap-v: horse leap
example.text: "I love that horse," she said in the hanging silence between the horse's leap over a two-post jump

roleset.note: LEAP-V NOTES: nominal 'leaping' based on BOLT-7. Member of Vncls run-51.3.2. (from leap.03-v)
LEAP-N NOTES: Member of Vncls run-51.3.2. (from leap.03-n)
LEAPING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from leaping.03-n)
